se.cbb.jprime.io

Class NewickVertex

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.io.NewickVertex

  • public class NewickVertex
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds a "pure" multifurcating Newick vertex or tree, typically used only as an intermediate form after reading tree input before creating more specialised representations (bifurcating, ultrametric, non-node based, etc.). Additional meta info (provided between brackets for a vertex) is held only as a string.

    Each vertex has containers for vertex number (ID), name, branch length, and additional meta info. All containers except number may take on empty values, in which case null is preferred.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

      • isBifurcating

        public boolean isBifurcating(boolean doRecurse)
        Returns true if a vertex is bifurcating, i.e. has either 0 or 2 children. Alternatively, one may consider the whole subtree rooted at the vertex.
        Parameters:
        doRecurse - true to consider the whole subtree rooted at the vertex.
        Returns:
        true if bifurcating.

      • isCollapsable

        public boolean isCollapsable(boolean doRecurse)
        Returns true if a vertex is collapsable, i.e. has a single child. Alternatively, one may consider the whole subtree rooted at the vertex.
        Parameters:
        doRecurse - true to consider the whole subtree rooted at the vertex.
        Returns:
        true if collapsable.

      • getNoOfDescendants

        public int getNoOfDescendants(boolean properOnly)
        Returns the number of descendants.
        Parameters:
        properOnly - false to count the vertex itself among its descendants.
        Returns:
        the number of proper or improper descendants.

      • getNoOfLeaves

        public int getNoOfLeaves()
        Returns the number of leaves of the subtree rooted at this vertex.
        Returns:
        the number of leaves.

      • renumber

        public int renumber(int num)
        Relabels the vertex numbers of the subtree rooted at this vertex post-order, starting from number no at the first leaf.
        Parameters:
        num - the number to start labelling from.
        Returns:
        the next free available number label.

      • sort

        public java.lang.String sort()
                      throws NewickIOException
        Recursively sorts the children of this vertex according to vertex names. If lacking name, a vertex is instead represented by the "smallest" name corresponding to the subtrees of its children. Unnamed children are stored last. Assumes that vertex names are unique (i.e., beware of bootstrap value names!).
        Returns:
        the name representing the subtree rooted at this vertex.
        Throws:
        NewickIOException - if there was a collision due to duplicate names while sorting.
